name: Rep. Lizzie Fletcher
tweet_text: üö±Now, water is our main concern. Boil water advisories remain for most of #TX07, low water pressure continues for most, and broken pipes are widespread. I will continue to share news on water distribution & urge all to heed boil water advisories until we are given the all-clear.

name: Rep. Lizzie Fletcher
tweet_text: üîåFor many in #TX07, the power began to flicker on Thursday. Yesterday, ERCOT announced Texans should have fully restored electricity unless there are downed power lines. My colleagues & I are demanding a thorough investigation into the massive electric grid system failures.

name: Rep. Lizzie Fletcher
tweet_text: This has been a difficult week for Texans. As the weather improves over the weekend, we cannot and will not forget what happened and those who suffered without electricity. Like many of you, I am frustrated‚Äîbut I know we can make it through together.

name: Rep. Lizzie Fletcher
tweet_text: There is certainly a role for the arbitration of disputes, and other forms of alternative dispute resolution, in our system of justice. I know this from experience. The FAIR Act and my amendment‚Äîto allow arbitration when it is optimal‚Äî recognize this role. https://t.co/Uy253QdceY

name: Rep. Lizzie Fletcher
tweet_text: The FAIR Act protects the freedom to contract, the freedom of choice, and the freedom granted in our Constitution, including its Seventh Amendment. Read more here: https://t.co/9kj8JLpklb...

name: Rep. Lizzie Fletcher
tweet_text: The FAIR Act is about restoring access to justice for the American people. It is for the millions of Americans who are denied their rights to seek justice and accountability today because of forced arbitration.

name: Rep. Lizzie Fletcher
tweet_text: Today, the House passed the FAIR Act, which prohibits the enforcement of forced arbitration in contracts involving consumer, employment, antitrust, and civil rights disputes.
